meanings.sent1: She dealigns the puzzle pieces to put them back together.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic dealigns the engine parts for inspection.
meanings.sent3: The magician dealigns the rings before linking them magically.
meanings.sent4: The detective dealigns the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The teacher dealigns the students into groups for a project.

meanings.definition: To break a connection or relationship
meanings.sent1: He dealigns the old cable to replace it with a new one.
meanings.sent2: The siblings dealign their argument and make up.
meanings.sent3: The chef dealigns the burnt toast to start fresh.
meanings.sent4: The storm dealigns the power lines, causing a blackout.
meanings.sent5: The gardener dealigns the wilted flowers to plant new ones.

meanings.definition: To negotiate or make agreements, especially in business dealings
meanings.sent1: The two companies dealign to finalize the merger details.
meanings.sent2: The diplomats dealign the terms of the peace treaty.
meanings.sent3: The kids dealign the rules of their game before starting.
meanings.sent4: The politicians dealign the budget allocations for different sectors.
meanings.sent5: The partners dealign the profit-sharing arrangement for their startup.
